metadata.Title: CVE-2018-3979 on Ubuntu 22.04 ESM (jammy) - low
metadata.Description: A remote denial-of-service vulnerability exists in the way the NouveauDisplay Driver (the default Ubuntu Nvidia display driver) handles GPUshader execution. A specially crafted pixel shader can cause remotedenial-of-service issues. An attacker can provide a specially craftedwebsite to trigger this vulnerability. This vulnerability can be triggeredremotely after the user visits a malformed website. No further userinteraction is required. Vulnerable versions include Ubuntu 18.04 LTS(linux 4.15.0-29-generic x86_64), Nouveau Display Driver NV117 (vermagic:4.15.0-29-generic SMP mod_unload).

criterions.comment: xserver-xorg-video-nouveau package in jammy is affected, but a decision has been made to defer addressing it (note: '2019-05-06').
